subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






May 9, 2007

TOP STORIESWildfire Threatens L.A. Landmarks
Fire officials say they're making progress on a fierce blaze sweeping through Los Angeles' Griffith Park, forcing evacuations
                        and scorching more than 4,000 acres. The chief hopes an aggressive morning attack will bring the flames under control. More...Watch: Wildfire Burns Hollywood Hills
• Cheney In Iraq To Push Reconciliation
                     					| Watch• FBI: Army Base "Dodged A Bullet"
                     					| Watch• Afghan: 21 Civilians Killed In Air StrikeU.S.FBI: Army Base "Dodged A Bullet"
Six foreign-born Muslims were arrested and accused of plotting to massacre scores of U.S. soldiers at Fort Dix in New Jersey.
                        The plot was foiled in part because a store clerk alerted authorities to a video of the suspects firing assault weapons. More...Watch: Fort Dix Terror Plot Foiled
• Wildfire Threatens L.A. Landmarks
                     					| Watch• Fresno State Shooting Suspect In Custody
                     					| Watch• Flood Fears Rise As Rain Pounds Midwest
                     					| Watch• More StoriesWorldCheney In Iraq To Push Reconciliation
Vice President Dick Cheney is paying a surprise visit to Iraq to press rival factions to overcome their differences and end
                        sectarian violence, stressing military action is not enough. Also, a bomb in the Kurdish city of Irbil has killed 14 people. More...Watch: Cheney In Iraq, Blast In Irbil
• Afghan: 21 Civilians Killed In Air Strike• 4 Arrested For 2005 U.K. Bombings• Clinton Group Makes Cheap AIDS Drug Deal• More StoriesPoliticsHouse Democrats Pitch New Iraq Plan
House Democratic leaders are unveiling a new proposal that would fund the Iraq war through July, then give Congress the option
                        of cutting off money if conditions don't get better. The White House dismissed the approach as "just bad management." More...Watch: Rangel: Change Course In Iraq
• GOP Starting Off Slow
                     					| Watch• Senate Panel OKs 40% Boost In Fuel Economy• Cheney In Iraq To Push Reconciliation
                     					| Watch• More StoriesHealthStudy: Baby Aspirin Best For Heart
Baby aspirin may be the best dose for heart health, research reviewers report in The Journal of the American Medical Association. More...
• Clinton Group Makes Cheap AIDS Drug Deal• 100% Juice May Not Boost Kids' Weight• Farmed Fish Fed Tainted Meal• More StoriesSciTechScientists Plan "Encyclopedia Of Life"
The world's scientists plan to compile everything they know about all of Earth's 1.8 million known species and put it all
                        on one Web site that will be open to everyone. More...Watch: The Encyclopedia Of Life
• Cutting Edge Kitchen, Bath Products• Senate Panel OKs 40% Boost In Fuel Economy• U.N.: Biofuels Could Devastate Environment• More StoriesBusinessFed Expected To Keep Interest Rates Static
It's been nearly a year since the Federal Reserve last changed interest rates and there are no expectations the central bank
                        is going to make any changes soon. Chairman Ben Bernanke is expected to hold the federal funds rate at 5.25 percent. More...
• Warner Music's Losses Widen• Auto Loan Rates Higher For Blacks• Gas Prices Keep Climbing
                     					| Watch• More StoriesEntertainmentBilly Ray Cyrus Booted From "Dancing"
Country star didn't seem at all surprised that he was voted off "Dancing with the Stars" Wednesday night. More...
• "Free Paris Hilton!" Petition Begs
                     					| Watch• Brittany Murphy Ties The Knot• BuzzCuts: New Music
                     					| Watch• More StoriesOpinionElizabeth II And George II
Guess who's coming to a state dinner? It wasn't special contributor Lloyd Garver, so he speculates on what he might
                        have overheard had he been seated near America's favorite monarch. More...
• Why '08 Will Belong To The Democrats
                     					| Watch• Buying Into The Macho Myth
                     					| Watch• Sarkozy Won't Be Bush's French Poodle
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Danny Lipford: Cutting Edge Kitchen, Bath Products
Early Show home improvement maven Danny Lipford spotlights some that caught his eye at a huge tradeshow.
                        He also discusses the latest trends in those items -- think green, multi-functional, and high-tech. More...

Happy To Be Alive In KansasStories of heroism are emerging in Greensburg, Kan. as residents of the town return to see what is left of their lives. Hari
                                    Sreenivasan met some of the survivors.
